headline: ServiceNow to buy cybersecurity startup Armis for $7.75 billion
summary: Dec 23 (Reuters) - ServiceNow (NOW) has agreed to buy cybersecurity startup Armis for $7.75 billion in cash, the companies said on Tuesday, ​as the enterprise software maker looks to attract new customers ‌amid growing risks of cyberattacks.

content.title: ServiceNow to buy cybersecurity startup Armis for $7.75 billion
content.summary: Dec 23 (Reuters) - ServiceNow (NOW) has agreed to buy cybersecurity startup Armis for $7.75 billion in cash, the companies said on Tuesday, ​as the enterprise software maker looks to attract new customers ‌amid growing risks of cyberattacks.

headline: ServiceNow to acquire Armis to expand cyber exposure and security across the full attack surface in IT, OT, and medical devices for companies, governments, and critical infrastructure worldwide
summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., December 23, 2025--ServiceNow (NYSE: NOW), the AI control tower for business reinvention, today entered into an agreement to acquire Armis for $7.75 billion in cash. Armis, a leader in cyber exposure management and cyber-physical security, manages cyber risk across the full attack surface in IT, operational technology (OT), medical devices, and other environments for companies, governments, and critical infrastructure worldwide. The acquisition will expand ServiceNow’s secur

headline: ServiceNow to Buy Cybersecurity Company Armis for $7.75 Billion
summary: ServiceNow  agreed to buy cybersecurity company Armis in an all-cash deal worth $7.75 billion—the largest acquisition in  ServiceNow’s  history.  Shares of ServiceNow fell 2%.  The stock tumbled last week following reports that the enterprise software company was close to buying Armis.

content.title: ServiceNow to Buy Cybersecurity Company Armis for $7.75 Billion
content.summary: ServiceNow  agreed to buy cybersecurity company Armis in an all-cash deal worth $7.75 billion—the largest acquisition in  ServiceNow’s  history.  Shares of ServiceNow fell 2%.  The stock tumbled last week following reports that the enterprise software company was close to buying Armis.

headline: ServiceNow to buy Armis for $7.75 billion as AI-fueled cyber risks surge
summary: ServiceNow on Tuesday agreed to buy cybersecurity startup Armis for $7.75 billion, in the ​enterprise software maker's biggest-ever deal, as it bolsters its services ‌to help counter rising cyberattacks driven by AI adoption.  Through the deal, the company aims to ‌integrate Alphabet-backed Armis' security features such as device scanning and threat detection, a crucial advantage amid sophisticated cyberattacks that have hit companies ranging from Microsoft to UnitedHealth Group.  However, ServiceNow's shares fell about 3%, as investors worried over the ⁠company's recent splurge on ‌acquisitions.

content.title: ServiceNow to buy Armis for $7.75 billion as AI-fueled cyber risks surge
content.summary: ServiceNow on Tuesday agreed to buy cybersecurity startup Armis for $7.75 billion, in the ​enterprise software maker's biggest-ever deal, as it bolsters its services ‌to help counter rising cyberattacks driven by AI adoption.  Through the deal, the company aims to ‌integrate Alphabet-backed Armis' security features such as device scanning and threat detection, a crucial advantage amid sophisticated cyberattacks that have hit companies ranging from Microsoft to UnitedHealth Group.  However, ServiceNow's shares fell about 3%, as investors worried over the ⁠company's recent splurge on ‌acquisitions.

headline: ServiceNow to acquire Armis for $7.75B, gold & silver record highs
summary: Market Domination host Josh Lipton tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including ServiceNow's (NOW) $7.75 billion acquisition of cybersecurity startup Armis, gold (GC=F) and silver's (SI=F) climb to new all-time highs, and Novo Nordisk (NVO) shares jumping after the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved its oral GLP-1 obesity pill. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

Market Domination host Josh Lipton tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including ServiceNow's (NOW) $7.75 billion acquisition of cybersecurity startup Armis, gold (GC=F) and silver's (SI=F) climb to new all-time highs, and Novo Nordisk (NVO) shares jumping after the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved its oral GLP-1 obesity pill.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.
